citation.article-title: Catenulispora rubra sp. nov., an acidophilic actinomycete isolated from forest soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Catenulispora rubra sp. nov.
Catenulispora rubra (ru′bra. L. fem. adj. rubra red).
Gram-positive, non-acid-fast aerobic actinomycete that forms extensively branched substrate hyphae.
The vegetative hypha is finely branched and does not fragment.
Monopodially or dichotomously branching aerial mycelia develop sparsely.
The aerial mycelium contains spore chains arranged in a hook-like or flexuous manner.
Spores (0.7–1.5 μm in diameter) are rod-shaped, smooth-surfaced and non-motile.
The optimum temperature range for growth is 20–30 °C, and optimum pH is 5.
d-Glucose, raffinose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, sucrose and fructose, but not inositol or rhamnose, are used as sole carbon sources.

Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase, leucine aminopeptidase, valine aminopeptidase, acid phosphatase, phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and trypsin, but negative for lipase, cystine aminopeptidase, α-galactosidase and α-fucosidase.
Hydrolyses starch and aesculin, but not gelatin or urea.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-9(H6) and MK-9(H8).
The cellular fatty acids consist of iso-branched, anteiso-branched, saturated and unsaturated fatty acids with iso-C16 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0 as major components.
The cell wall contains ll-A2pm and glycine (peptidoglycan type A3γ′ sensu Schleifer & Kandler, 1972).
The DNA G+C content is 69.1 mol%.
The type strain, Aac-30T (=NBRC 101179T=DSM 44948T), was isolated from forest soil in Oodate, Japan.
